Specialties:programming in html, c, xml, vxml, parity, css, sql, jsp Experience Software Engineer XO Communications December 2005  – Present (9 years 9 months) Beaverton, OR IVR programmer in parity and vxml with some java. My knowledge and exceptional people skills is an asset to this organization. I assist Project Managers, database administrators and QA Engineers on the details of a project to insure the success and on time delivery of a project. I develop and test code for telephone menu programs that use a database or XML for data. I rewrote legacy applications from intervoice to dialogic to get rid of old equipment. I create new enhanced voice services applications in VXML, JSP 2.0 and Parity (like C). I unit test the programs and pass them onto QA. I also modify existing applications for change requests and fix trouble tickets. I am continuing my Java2 education due to the increasing need of these skills in my current position. QA Engineer XO Interactive April 2000  –  December 2005  (5 years 9 months) Portland, Oregon Area I handled many projects simultaneously. I was very proactive when handed a project and completed them before the deadline. I have created QA documentation for many large projects and have written large test plans and executed the manual cases and automated scripts. Creating and maintaining automated Hammer scripts was my responsibility. I used SQL Advantage for database verification. My duties were to test software for telecommunication programs – Interactive Voice Response (IVR). I wrote VB scripts to test these phone applications. Additionally I test web sites with web, IVR, and database interaction. I am very proficient in NT and OS2 operating systems. I used a UNIX platform to test Middleware connections and logging for IVR Applications. I used different programs for remote access to VRUs (Voice Response Units): PolyPM and Timbuktu. I was responsible for testing 3 applications that generate 50 percent of XOI’s revenue. QA Engineer Tektronix 1997  –  1999  (2 years) My responsibilities were to develop, executed, and maintain software test plans for color printers (laser, solid ink and medical). I wrote files and scripts in PostScript, Silk and QATalk. I reported and verified bugs. I manipulated hardware to test software. I tested plug-ins for Photoshop 4.0. I created and maintained tests for the following: Configurations, Localization (FIGS & CCJK), Resetting, Built-In Pages, Color Imaging (CRDs, VCDs, Print Quality, TekColor Correction), Front Panel. I had to follow FDA guidelines while testing medical imaging printers. I worked on three different platforms: Windows (95, 98), UNIX (Xterm), Mac (OS8.0). I used Silk to test the functionality of HTML pages in the printer. I tested scanners connected to Tek printers as copiers. I used ClearCase XDDTS for the bug system. QA Engineer Intel January 1997  –  April 1997  (4 months) I contracted as a software technician at Intel Corporation as a project assistant in international publications. I troubleshot help files for communication programs in many foreign languages for localization (FIGS & CCJK). I checked files in and out for source control. I had bug scrubs twice a week with program testers. I manipulated graphics for help manuals and online help with Photoshop 4.0. I tested software on Asian Operating systems (CCJK). Software Tester Sharp 1997  –  1997  (less than a year) I contracted as a software tester at Sharp Labs of America in Camas, WA as a Software Tester for Sharp copiers. I worked with Genoa tests for PCL and PS. I reported and verified bugs. I used PostScript and PCL to make files for testing. I tested localized pages (FIGS) and front panel. Sales Technician Xerox December 1995  –  October 1996  (11 months) As a Document Management System Analyst, I assisted copier marketing executives as a System Analyst with demos, customer training and connection of color copiers as printers on networks. I specialized in copier front ends (Fiery, Splash, UFO, Cyclone). I used Xerox copiers as printers: 4700, 4900, 5765, 5790, DCS20, DCS35, DC40, DT135. I worked with publishing programs for flyers and training screens. I successfully completed Xerox courses in Quality Training and Sales Analysis. 26V Strategic Microwave Systems Repairer us army October 1984  –  October 1988  (4 years 1 month) Trained for 960 hours in telecommunication electronics, both analog and digital. I maintained and troubleshot three different multiplex communication systems in Southern Europe (Italy). Summary Hands-on Technology Leader who thrives on turning around challenged businesses, building cohesive teams, and developing new platforms that enable companies to rapidly change direction, scale for growth, and accelerate sales. 
 
Delivered SaaS, Big Data, distributed, server, and desktop solutions in varied environments including Fortune 100, start-up, and mid sized privately held businesses. 
 
Recruited and managed cross functional teams comprised of software, database, network, system, and support staff who built the technology that drove a statistical/arbitrage business, for Schonfeld, from $0 to over $100 million in profit within 1.5 years. 
 
Experienced in applying Agile methodologies and principles to reduce product delivery schedules and improve customer satisfaction. 
 
Scaled proprietary securities trading systems and quantitative trading strategies to manage trades of 600 million shares per day and more than $1 billion in market exposure.
